page.title: 03Farming 3
page.content: Mr. J.S.Dakin and Co. Ltd. farm a large arable farm of 4200 acres.The soil and climate of the area are suited to this. Over the last 60 years there have been changes in farming in the area. The Dakin Company have noticed that farms are now larger, there are more farming companies such as theirs, hedgerows have been taken out and fewer animals are now kept as it is no longer economical. The government controls the price of cereals and gives grants for the beef, dairy and sheep sections of the farming industry. The Common Market affects farming prices. Cereals are sold to local mills. Cattle are sold at Newark market. Dakins have their own transporters.
